name: Sheraton Kansas City Hotel at Crown Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at several Hyatt hotels and this one was the best hands down. The staff was incredible; super polite and very helpful. The room was modern and clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. We were in town for a concert at the Sprint Center and the hotel offered shuttle service to and from the arena!
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, great service

reviews.text: The hotel is connected to the Crown Center via The Link, which is a glass walkway. There's a shopping center with stores and several places to eat. We were able to grab lunch at Einstein Bagel and do some shopping without having to drive anywhere. Super convenient.
reviews.title: Standard Hyatt, well done

reviews.text: We got a great deal on the room ($70/night) by bidding online. Self-parking was $14.50. I will stay here the next time I'm in KC.
reviews.title: The Titanic of hotels: big and beautiful, but it goes down from there.

reviews.text: This hotel is a standard hyatt, nothing really special but well done. They lost my funds pre-authorization but that I something Hyatt seems to include as part of training for their front of house and billing staff.
reviews.title: mmm...thanks but no!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar, occupied by the Future Farmers of American Convention attendees, was jumping and service good. Room service til 1am was efficient with an excellent soup and BBQ sandwich. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is east of the river, away from some of the business district - check before you reserve.
reviews.title: Attitude

reviews.text: stayed there for 3 nights no one in our room except the housekeeper on the last day my H.D. check book and credit cards and pictures was stolen
reviews.title: stolen check book

reviews.text: *Good conference hotel, however the business center was pricey and not free.
reviews.title: Good conference hotel

reviews.text: *Connected to Crown Center
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.text: *Express elevator to floors 28 and above made for quicker rides during busy conference times.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Room - 33rd floor - king. Roomy for a single traveler. Double bedded rooms slightly more crowded. Good desk space. Not enough power outlets. Ask hotel for a surge protector or bring your own. Need to ask for a coffee maker in room as all rooms do not have one. Nice bathroom amenities, even included a tube of travel sized toothpaste. No make up mirror! Not all rooms were wired for internet so be sure to ask if you need it. Mini refrigerator was very useful. Ipod clock radio nice touch.
reviews.title: All-Purpose Hotel
AAA+++
reviews.text: We loved our stay. Check in was a snap. The bell staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and clean and we had a great view of downtown Kansas City from our room on the 32 floor. The lobby was spacious and a nice mix of contemporary and old world charm. A great place to people watch and the free wireless in the lobby made it a nice place to find a cozy nook. The walkway to the Crowne Center shops made shopping a breeze, and museumsand theatres were in walking distance, also. We were able to get to the Power and Light district in 5 minutes. the Plaza was an easy quick drive. The hot tub, pools and work out areas were nice. AND great food at all the dining establishments.
Don't forget tip tip the shoe shine gentleman!~
reviews.title: Great hotel. Great views. Great food!

reviews.text: Stayed here for a conference and loved it! The location was nice and the rooms were stylish and comfortable as well. I had a great view from one of the top floors. I also happened to spend a lot of time making calls and working in the lobby area, as it's really spacious and well-light. It was surprisingly quite and the fountain is a nice touch. But the best/coolest part was definitely one of the hotel's restaurants. Went to an event at Skies which is at the top of the hotel so it has amazing 360 views. And the best part was it revolved. So cool! Can't wait to stay again.
reviews.title: Getting better, but still the Hyatt Crown Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've had hardly better than awful experiences with Hyatt hotels during my travels, and last time I stayed at this hotel, I got extremely poor service, including a phone call in the middle of the night (4:00 a.m.) to tell me that the person who was supposed to bring up my coffee maker had already left.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, excellent room - very nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, this time around, check-in was painless and possibly even pleasant. I used the computer check-in, but there was a woman working the line who took down all of our requests. Our bellman was fantastic, and the rollaway bed and coffee maker were in our room before we could even get our stuff unpacked. Really quite fast service for a hotel that was seeing at least a couple hundred rooms being checked into on one day.
reviews.title: Nice for what we ended up paying

reviews.text: The staff was very accomidating to my business schedule and allowed me to check-in early. This is a great hotel for business travel, with plenty of amenities. Would highly recommend to any traveler, business or leisure, and I would definetly stay again.
reviews.title: Very accomidating
Kansas City Hyatt Regency Crown Center Review
reviews.text: The rooms were spotless clean, we enjoyed all the amenities, the staff was very helpful and accomodating and the facilities were excellent. Lots of fun stuff to do in the nearby Crown Center and Plaza areas.

This hotel has excellent customer service- from the front desk clerks, to the maids, to the restaurant staff. The room was clean, had a fridge, a pretty good view of downtown... The fitness center they have is superb.
reviews.title: Above Average

reviews.text: There is no free wifi... You have to pay for parking, almost $15 a day...
reviews.title: Solid Service

reviews.text: A great escape between 2 hard days of work. Very nice room, super comfortable and high level of service. I was only there overnight...but wanted to stay longer!
reviews.title: In one word.............okay

aka: Sheraton Kansas City Hotel At Crown Kansas City
description: Sheraton Kansas City Hotel at Crown Center is located downtown near the Kauffman Performing Arts Ctr and other attractions. Our hotel has 5 on-site dining options and high speed internet access.
